thread.title: Glass hopes students fill Memorial Stadium for memorable Saturday #iufb
thread.title_full: Glass hopes students fill Memorial Stadium for memorable Saturday #iufb

author: Mike Miller, The Hoosier Scoop
title: Glass hopes students fill Memorial Stadium for memorable Saturday #iufb
text:
Larger font size Posted: Wednesday, September 30, 2015 10:04 pm | Updated: 11:20 pm, Wed Sep 30, 2015. Glass hopes students fill Memorial Stadium for memorable Saturday #iufb Mike Miller, The Hoosier Scoop heraldtimesonline.com | 0 comments 
Fred Glass met his wife at an Indiana football game. He remembers a childhood spent listening to his father’s stories of watching Old Oaken Bucket games in the freezing bleachers and, as IU prepares to host No. 1 Ohio State on Saturday, he hopes to make the Memorial Stadium experience a memorable one for students this weekend. 
The IU athletic director appeared on coach Kevin Wilson’s weekly radio show Wednesday to discuss his department’s plan to offer students $10 tickets from the school’s general public allotment. With Indiana expecting its first sellout since the Michigan game in 2010, Glass is hoping the discounted tickets encourage more IU students to attend the game and create memories around the football program’s best start in 25 years. kAm“(6 C62==J H2?E DEF56?ED E@ 92G6 2? 6IA6C:6?46 96C6[” v=2DD D2:5] “(6 H2?E E9:D E@ 36 @?6 @7 E9@D6 82>6D H96C6 WDEF56?ED 42?
